good question! Don't know: install it in some unused part of a partition
the whole point is making the new grub realise there is some other OS and put that in the grub
you didn't have any spare space?
anyway, my idea is this: install it in unused space. Then, the GRUB will recognize the Ubuntu you had before and put it in GRUB
afterwards, you remove the newly installed ubuntu
is like using a needle to get another needle out
